title: Microtasks
description: The Microtasks in JS are high-priority asynchronous tasks in the event loop that are executed after the current execution stack and before the next macrotask.
content: The high-priority asynchronous tasks in the JavaScript event loop that are executed after the current execution stack and before the next macrotask, following the completion of any synchronous code. Examples include `Promise` callbacks and `MutationObserver` callbacks.
